name: Single Agent
description: Features a single agent designed to handle straightforward tasks efficiently without additional complexity. Ideal for simple, clearly defined tasks. Example use: summarizing short documents or answering basic questions.

name: Reflection
description: Consists of two agentsâ€”a main agent performing the primary task and a reflection agent that reviews performance and provides iterative feedback to improve performance. Suitable for tasks requiring refinement through feedback loops. Example use: iteratively improving a text draft or refining a strategic plan.

name: Discussion
description: Engages multiple agents with distinct personas and roles in a collaborative dialogue, fostering creativity, brainstorming, idea generation, debate, and consensus building. Best for tasks benefiting from diverse perspectives. Example use: collaborative discussion, or strategic decision-making discussions.

name: Redundant
description: Redundant pattern can be seem as Parallel with multiple agents executing simultaneously, each addressing a specific aspect of the task, with outputs aggregated programmatically. Effective for parallel working on the task with slightly different aspects. Example use: reviewing the same input content simultaneously to aggregate diverse insights.

name: Supervision
description: Combines a supervisor agent overseeing multiple specialized worker agents. The supervisor dynamically routes requests based on varying requirements, efficiently managing and coordinating workers. Suitable for tasks with diverse and shifting focuses. Example use: diagnosing and classifying input to delegate them to specialized worker agents, such as refining content in aspects of creativity, clarity, or accuracy.

name: Web Search Agent
description: Utilizes a single agent equipped with web search capabilities to gather relevant information online. Ideal for tasks requiring extensive online research. Example use: conducting market research or gathering recent scientific findings.
